location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 2: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to John Wedderburn, Accountant General, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges the receipt of a circular letter, dated 16 December 1820, which referred to the printed regulations from 23 October. The circular letter concerns a new absentee fund which relates to leave of absence obtained by civil servants, which must be accounted for in the Residency's books.
